summary: China's Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) and China's State Administration for Market Regulation (SAMR) could get in the way Nvidia's Arm acquisition.

summary: The changes apply to all Instagram users in the U.K. and anyone globally who directs their posts toward Brits.
headline: Instagram vows to fight hidden ads amid UK competition probe

summary: As China recovers from the coronavirus pandemic, the country's central bank is more open to increasing loans to an already debt-heavy system than it is to cutting back.
headline: China is open to taking on more debt if that's what it takes to support the economy
Stay-at-home stocks like Zoom will 'keep roaring' until there is a coronavirus vaccine, says Cramer
summary: "The stay-at-home story, it's not quitting," CNBC's Jim Cramer said. "I bet they're going to keep roaring until we all have been vaccinated."

headline: Bill Gates says that antitrust regulators should look at tech companies separately, not all at once

summary: As it faces down the long barrel of antitrust enforcers and a revenue slowdown, Google is taking pains to show it still innovates in its original core business.

summary: "This morning's Europe-inspired sell-off turned out to be the perfect buying opportunity," CNBC's Jim Cramer said.

headline: ‘No doubt’ that crucial U.S. fiscal stimulus is coming, IMF managing director says
Investment in space companies bounced back in the third quarter from the COVID-19 lull, report says
summary: Private investment in space companies in the third quarter bounced back after a significant dip, according to a Space Capital report.

headline: How much you need to invest every month to retire with $1 million to $3 million, broken down by age
summary: If you begin now, you can save $1 million, $2 million or $3 million with the right amount of time and dedication. How much you'll need to save every month will depend on how old you are when you start saving and how much money you want for retirement.
Short-term funding markets seized up during the early days of the coronavirus pandemic, demonstrating that more reform is needed, the Federal Reserve's chief banking overseer said Thursday.
headline: Fed's Quarles sees need for more reforms to short-term funding markets
YouTube tightens rules on conspiracy videos, but stops short of banning QAnon
summary: YouTube told CNBC that it doesn't consider QAnon a monolithic entity that can be banned — but one that has sprawling tentacles sometimes interwoven with truth or gray areas.

summary: United Airlines CEO expects a long path to recovery without a vaccine, which he expects at the end of next year.

headline: Facebook and Twitter CEOs will have to answer to Senate Republicans after Biden NY Post story controversy
summary: Facebook and Twitter gave different reasons and methods of reducing distribution of the Post story, which the Biden campaign has rebutted.

headline: Cramer says investors will regret selling U.S. stocks on coronavirus spikes in Europe
summary: "I think we're importing their negativity. I don't think it's necessarily going to last," CNBC's Jim Cramer said on Thursday morning.
